bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, October 21, 1937

div1.p: Kean's writes about his surgery for cataracts and provides news of friends and acquaintances.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Albert E. Truby, October 21, 1937

opener.dateline:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Oct. 21st
1937

div1.p:
I have been a poor
correspondent for the past
6 months as my blindness
from the cataracts increas-
ed so much in the spring
that I was unable to write
your pleasant letter from
up in the mountains last
July found me in the Eye
Hospital of the Columbia Hospital
Center
2
in New York where Dr John
M. Wheeler operated in my
left eye July 8th you know
my right eye has never been
any good so Ireland deci-
ded that I must go to the
most experienced man as
a failure would knock
me out for good & all-
I did splendidly for three
weeks, when, for no reason
at all, I woke up one
morning with an initis
which has left a little
band of exudate across
3
the pupil, so that I can-
not quite read yet- It
has been a year & a month
since I read a book or
a newspaper- But I can
use my eye for many
things, such as writing
cards and recognizing my
friends- There is some
hope that this exudate
may be absorbed, but if it
does'nt it can be pushed
to one side with a needle
which is I believe not a
very risky operation-

I dont see many of our old
friends as I go out very
little - but Ireland is always
the same good brother to
me and drops in several
times a week, to give me
the news & the 'once over'-
McCaw was here at the Club
for two weeks leaving yester-
day- He is the same old
Willie, as clever and as
self centered as ever, and
looks very well & hand-
some- He walks quite well
now, but talks about little
cardiac twing as nothing very
Oct 21, 1937
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON, D. C.
serious, I hope-

Reynolds is making a fine
S. G- and has a much
better head on him that
old man Bob P. did-
I dont hear much of your
girls except on the rare
occasions when I see
Richard La Garde - but
they and I move in circles
which are half a century
apart- It was funny about
woman not being in your
picture of the H. C. Company
C2
B5
was'nt it! I have been
owing him a letter for
6 months - and as he is a
sensitive fellow I must
be sending him a line-
I miss Lynch who has
bought a house in St. Peters-
burg Fla and stayed
there all the summer-
He & I used to get together
for lunch at the Club
about once a week-
Give my love & good wishes
to your very attractive wife
in which Cornelia would join
it she were by me.
